channel.title: MacBreak (HD video)
channel.description: Insanely great Mac TV. Feed your Mac and your mind with the best.
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike - http://creativecommons.org/
channel.itunes:subtitle: The first hi-def IPTV show all about the Mac
channel.itunes:summary: The only Macintosh show you'll ever need. Mac experts Leo Laporte, Kendra Arimoto, Emery Wells, Merlin Mann and Alex Lindsay talk about everything Mac, including hardware, software, pro apps, and tips. Every show includes interviews with the most interesting people in the Mac universe. Shot in 1080p high definition because your Mac deserves the very best.
channel.itunes:author: Leo Laporte, Kendra Arimoto, Emery Wells, Merlin Mann and Alex Lindsay

item.title: MacBreak 166: MacBreak: Tubemogul
item.description: Alex explains the advantages of using Tubemogul to upload and track your online media.
item.itunes:author: Alex Lindsay
item.itunes:subtitle: Alex explains the advantages of using Tubemogul to upload and track your online media.

item.title: MacBreak 165: MacBreak: Blu-ray Encoding in Compressor
item.description: Brian Gary talks with Alex about Blu-ray encoding in Compressor.
item.itunes:author: Alex Lindsay
item.itunes:subtitle: Brian Gary talks with Alex about Blu-ray encoding in Compressor.

item.itunes:subtitle: MacBreak Minute: Kenji shows you the the Cmd-Tab keyboard shortcut for quickly moving between open applications.

item.title: MacBreak 64: Apple TV
item.description: Leo and Merlin discuss the new Apple TV at the Pixel Corps Gear Media Tech conference.

item.itunes:subtitle: Leo and Merlin discuss the new Apple TV at the Pixel Corps Gear Media Tech conference.

item.title: MacBreak 63: TextExpander
item.description: Leo and Merlin discuss TextExpander, which saves you keystrokes with customized abbreviations for frequently used text.
item.itunes:author: Leo Laporte
item.itunes:subtitle: Leo and Merlin discuss TextExpander, which saves you keystrokes with customized abbreviations for frequently used text.

item.title: MacBreak 62: Summarize

item.itunes:subtitle: Kenji Kato shows us how to use a little-known summarization tool buried in the Services menu.

item.itunes:subtitle: Leo's back with producer Kwesi Collisson to discuss the techniques used to complete a scene from the film 'Conversations with Other Women'.

item.itunes:subtitle: Merlin Mann is back to talk about Path Finder, a feature-rich alternative to OS X's Finder.

item.itunes:subtitle: Ben Long shows us how to match the colors in our printed photos to those on-screen using Photoshop's color matching tools.
